thread.title: Man United boss Jose Mourinho insists he will be happy even if Zlatan Ibrahimovic decides to leave Old Trafford
thread.title_full: Man United boss Jose Mourinho insists he will be happy even if Zlatan Ibrahimovic decides to leave Old Trafford

author: Jake Polden
title: Man United boss Jose Mourinho insists he will be happy even if Zlatan Ibrahimovic decides to leave Old Trafford
text:
Man United boss Jose Mourinho insists he will be happy even if Zlatan Ibrahimovic decides to leave Old Trafford The Swedish striker is unsure whether to sign a one-year contract extension for next season Share Zlatan Ibrahimovic has yet to decide his Man United future (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho has insisted he will be happy even if Zlatan Ibrahimovic decides to leave Manchester United at the end of the season. 
The Swede has been a revelation since signing on a free transfer in the summer, and has found the back of the net 15 times for the Red Devils this season. 
Currently he is unsure whether to sign a one-year contract extension for next season, despite the club desperate to retain his services. 
The 35-year-old has been linked with a potential move to the MLS after he previously vowed to "conquer" the United States. Jose Mourinho insisted he will be happy even if Ibrahimovic leaves (Photo: Getty) The Swede is unsure whether to sign a one-year contract extension (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) 
And Mourinho, who reinstated he would rather keep the player, insisted he wouldn't begrudge him if he was to leave Old Trafford in the summer. 
"I am just calm and waiting for the decision," Mourinho said, in an interview with Sky Sports, which will air on Soccer Saturday. 
"If the decision is for him to stay and he is happy with that, we are delighted with that. 
"If his decision is to leave and try to find a different challenge, I will be also happy for him." Mourinho said he wouldn't begrudge Ibrahimovic if he was to leave Old Trafford (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Mourinho acknowledged Ibrahimovic has been a huge part of United's success (Photo: Getty) 
The Portuguese acknowledged the forward has been a huge part of United's success this season as the club closes in on a top four finish. 
But ultimately conceded that Ibrahimovic's own needs are more important in this case, and if he and his family are indeed happier else where then so be it. poll loading Will Zlatan Ibrahimovic sign a new contract at Manchester United? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
